artifact.content: System must allow adding and removing of customers� accounts.
System must allow editing of customers� accounts, such as name, phone number, and bill plan type.
Administrator has the privilege of modifying a customer�s account status
System must allow IPs to be assigned to phone subsystems.
System must allow IPs to be removed from phone subsystems.
System must allow phone numbers to be assigned to IPs.
System must allow phone numbers to be removed from IPs.
System must check the validity of administrator�s input/request, to make sure they are valid.
System must provide functions for administrator to perform hardware and connectivity test.
System must provide functions for administrator to reset each phone subsystem�s software.
System must allow administrator to add or remove a bill plan.
Administrator must be able to change the content of a bill plan through mechanisms provided by the system.
Administrator must be able to record a payment received once a customer has paid the bill.
Administrator must be able to start up the console system
Administrator must be able to shut down the console system
System check the ID and password are valid before granting access to an administrator
Administrator must be able to search a particular customer�s account information
Administrator must be able to search all information associated with a particular phone number
Administrator can perform search on the all phone numbers that are not associated with an IP
Administrator must be able to search all information associated with an IP.
Administrator can perform search on all IPs that are not associated with a phone subsystem
System must enforce atomic operations when processing requests such as assigning IPs and phone numbers
Administrator can request to display current system load on the system console
Administrator can set the phone subsystem status through provided system console GUI
Administrator must be able to set the max number of concurrent calls allowed
When an IP is used, it is validated to ensure it is a usable IP.
At the end of each billing period, the system will automatically generate bills for all serviced customers
Administrator should be able to set a list of number that are blocked in customers accounts
Each time a customer makes a call, the number he or she dials is checked against the database for validity
All customer records are stored. Upon canceling of service, the record will remain in system database for up to 6 months.
System enables communication of 2 customers by creating an audio path between two phone subsystems.
When a conversation is completed, the system close the audio path created.
The system must track the time an account is being suspended.
When an account is moved to cancel state, the system will track the time it has been in cancelled state.
The system must be constantly monitoring a phone subsystem for events.
System must provide a mapping set between IP and phone numbers for reference
When an account is cancelled, a bill is generated immediately for all services the customer has used.
System must maintain a log containing all errors occurred to hardware components of the system.
When an exceptional situation occurs, the calling customer will receive a voice reply indicating the situation encountered.
When customer picks up the phone, a dial tone is sent to the phone subsystem indicating ready to receive numbers.
System keeps track of the system working load, and this data is updated every minute
System must ensure all charges are targeted at the calling customer.
System must perform tests automatically to check if all hardware components are working properly.
Upon detecting of an error by automatic fault detection, a signal is sent to the system console notifying the administrator of such incident.
System must record all services a customer has used automatically.
System must provide mechanisms for customer to set up speed dial numbers through the phone subsystems.
System must allow customer to initiate a call through phone subsystem.
System must allow receiving of a call
When a conversation is complete, system must terminate the call.
Emergency numbers such as 911 must be pre-installed in the phone subsystem.
The system should be able to block calls from undesired caller that appear on the customer�s blocked list
The system console GUI must be easy and intuitive for administrator to use
The phone subsystem must be easy for customers to operate
There must be more than one plan for customer to choose from
When a signal is received at a phone subsystem from automatic fault detection, it must response with in 5 seconds
The system must maintain acceptable efficiency, regardless of the system load.
If a new phone subsystem is to be added to the network, system must provide easy functions for administrator to connect the phone to the system.
The system, when placed in new hardware of the same type, should behave the same way as they are supposed to
The system must be developed within the cost budget
The data and system functions should not be accessed in anyway by people who do not have the right privilege.
System should be protected from invalid inputs and continue to operate normally.
